sn17.38-43:4.2: “Possessions, honor, and popularity are brutal, bitter, and harsh. They’re an obstacle to reaching the supreme sanctuary.
sn17.38-43:4.3: When I’ve comprehended the mind of a certain person, I understand:
sn17.38-43:4.4: ‘This venerable would not tell a deliberate lie even for the sake of their mother. …
sn17.38-43:4.11: But some time later I see them tell a deliberate lie because their mind is overcome and overwhelmed by possessions, honor, and popularity.
sn17.38-43:4.12: That’s how brutal, bitter, and harsh are possessions, honor, and popularity. They’re an obstacle to reaching the supreme sanctuary.
sn17.38-43:4.13: So you should train like this:
sn17.38-43:4.14: ‘We will give up arisen possessions, honor, and popularity, and we won’t let them occupy our minds.’
sn17.38-43:8.1: The Linked Discourses on possessions, honor, and popularity are complete.
